page.title: 03The Old Pier & Quay.
page.content: Our area has a derelict pier called the Royal Pier. Parts of it are falling into the sea,and most of it is rotting.The Quay is used by{ferries {and hydrofoils}to the Isle of Wight and many passengers come and go each day to work in the city.Around our area there are associated depots {shipyards}and storage areas.There are the{docks}nearby,and a road interchange.There is a Putting course, just outside Mayflower Park. Our square is mostly sea and mud banks.The River Test runs by.There are watersports as well, and the Blue Funnel{ferry}is nearby. There are old unused railway lines which used to carry freight from the{Old Docks}to the{New Docks}.There is a Corporation Bus Interchange by the Town Quay .From the Town Quay ferries cross Southampton Water to Hythe.
